item.title: What is the role of Data Analytics in sports?
item.description: Decisions in sports are not driven by the spirit of a game as one might think. Sports analytics is a growing market that uses statistical tools to make informed decisions on the field and in the office. From recruitment, game play strategy, and player performance, data rules the decisions to find trends in order to successfully win matches. In team sports like basketball and soccer, data analytics helps target undervalued players.

item.title: Premier League’s Top Performer: Data
item.description: Unlike basketball, football, and baseball that have several mechanisms at play to better predict a game, soccer has traditionally been known to be an ever changing sport that strays away from any sort of calculated strike to determine the match of a game. Finally, after years of spontaneity and tradition, data analytics has found its way into the hands of the English Premier League. Through data-driven analysis, it has changed the way soccer is not just played, but managed.

item.title: Stress in Real-Time
item.description: More than ever, adults in their 20s are stressed. We’re either recently graduated in the time of a global pandemic, or dealing with the painful reality of society’s issues. At our heart, we all have our own individual stressors that we push down and bottle-up till the bubbled compression becomes too much. We distract ourselves with social media and netflix and instant-gratification purchases off of Amazon. How do we deal with this growing pressure of living in constant pressure and stress?
